info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 27 at 9:48PM CDT until March 28 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
FFWBRO
The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Hidalgo County in deep south Texas...
* Until 100 AM CDT.
* At 948 PM CDT, Local law enforcement reported multiple water rescues ongoing in multiple areas across southeastern Hidalgo County. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Southeastern Hidalgo County. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Weslaco, Donna, Mercedes, Progreso, Llano Grande, Weslaco East High School, Black Elementary School, Knapp Medical Center, Estero Llano Grande State Park, Isaac D. Rodriguez Park, Weslaco City Park, Weslaco Public Library, Weslaco Fire Department Station Two, Weslaco City Hall, South Texas High School For Health Professions, Harlon Block Sports Complex, Villa Verde, Weslaco Fire Department Station One and Alameda Park.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR SOUTHEASTERN HIDALGO COUNTY
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 1:00 AM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 1:00 AM CDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR SOUTHEASTERN HIDALGO COUNTY
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 1:00 AM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 1:00 AM CDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
